{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3155011,"name":"Mohammad Awwad","username":"mohd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohd/{size}/184621_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-01T03:05:02.259Z","cooked":"

Hi all, i am having some issue with the MK4i modules where sometimes the robot randomly disides to vigerously shake, with ma having no control over the modules. One thing that I have noticed that fixes this issue is simply redeploying. However it may reoccure if i was to disable and re -enable the robot.

Here is my github repo incase it helps

GitHub

GitHub - FRC-6390/FRC-Season-2023

Contribute to FRC-6390/FRC-Season-2023 development by creating an account on GitHub.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-03-01T03:05:02.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":316,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":1611.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428518,"topic_slug":"swerve-modules-shaking-on-enable","display_username":"Mohammad Awwad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/FRC-6390/FRC-Season-2023","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - FRC-6390/FRC-Season-2023","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42590,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-modules-shaking-on-enable/428518/1","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3155108,"name":"Molly Connolly","username":"Molly_Connolly","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-01T04:58:50.078Z","cooked":"

I don’t have a solution for you, but we seem to be having a similar issue.
When we re-enable the robot, our elevator command is very shaky. It appears that the current command is fighting the command that was running right before the robot was previously disabled.
We aren’t sure if the shaking is directly caused by our code or if is related to the existing driver station issues.
Right now, our temporary fix is to restart driver station everytime that we disable. It would be really interesting to see if that also will stop your robot from shaking too. Please try and report back!

Thanks, i will definetly give it a try tommorow at comp :), watch 6390 at the candian pacific regional of ur intreseted

Not sure this applies in any particular case given here, but be sure you have the turn angle sensor and the turn motor set up so they agree about the direction of rotation that is positive and that which is negative. In particular, MK4i with CANCoder (and probably other encoders) needs to have the steering motor set as inverted. If you don’t do this, steering won’t work and will tend to shake.

After digging more, I think our issues are completely unrelated. It turned out our current limiting logic was stopping the elevator. So the PID would ramp up, get stopped, wind up, go, get stopped etc.

Well after revisting this problem i found out that it had to do with our cintant drift correction code, not sure what exactly is making it go crazy, especially since it is not consistent
